Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
Brand New in Shrink
I will be shipping USPS (50.00 total with shipping). Please check my Trade and Market Rating for reliability. Thanks!
Played 4-5 times.

boardgame.name: War of the Ring: Second Edition – Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
This insert is compatible with War of the Ring: Second Edition, Lords of Middle-Earth and Warriors of Middle-Earth expansions, including the Treebeard mini and the promo cards from Tidings Not Burdens mini-expansion.

The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times. The board and rule books act as a lid on top of the trays.

The insert is arranged in up to three layers, with a large card tray at one end of the box.

There are trays for all the dice and tokens. All the types of plastic figures have their own dedicated trays, with divisions by type where possible. All these trays can be used during game play to keep the table top tidy.

There is a large card tray that goes at one end of the box. The tray has space for all cards to be sleeved. The tray can either be left in the game box or removed to store cards on the table top.

Once the insert trays are packed into the box you need to next place the two game boards on top of the trays. These are followed by the rule books, with the large reference cards added as shown. Once fully loaded the box is filled to the top, allowing for vertical storage.

Note: This product is intended for a box size of 40.6 x 27.9 x 9.1 cm.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: War of the Ring: Lords of Middle-earth
War of the Ring: Lords of Middle-earth – Treebeard Mini-Expansion
War of the Ring: Second Edition
War of the Ring: Warriors of Middle-earth
War of the Ring: Warriors of Middle-earth – Tidings Not Burdens Mini-Expansion

boardgame.name: Hallertau: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
This insert is compatible with Hallertau. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times. The insert is arranged in up to four layers.

All component types are split by type organising all the game components. Each player has their own player piece tray.

There is space for all cards to be sleeved. Each of the four card decks used during a game have their own trays which can be placed directly onto the board. Then the three gateway and farmyard decks not currently in use are stored in the larger vertical card trays.

Below the lower three layers of trays, there's a filler tray on the side to position the stack of larger tiles.

When packing the box first place the community center, overview and jewel box tiles on top of the filler tray on the right-hand side. Next place the four stable boards on top in the recess provided for them. Then place the remaining larger boards on top of the trays, and lastly add the rule book as shown. Once fully loaded the box is filled to the top, allowing for vertical storage.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 31.8 x 22.6 x 10.3 cm.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Hallertau

listing.notes: Title: Folded Space Organizer - Hallertau Insert Publisher: Folded Space Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Flott's Miscellany Volume Two
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

FLOTT'S MISCELLANY VOLUME TWO is a system-agnostic RPG zine offering a wonderfully curated collection of random charts, name lists, esoteric and unusual facts, and even more lists about the Rainy City–a doomed fantasy metropolis at the end of the world where the wizards jealously guard their rotting magical tomes, the gargoyles are always watching, the thieves are on the prowl, and the rains never stop!

Like the first volume of the MISCELLANY, which came out last fall, this is built as a companion to A VISITOR'S GUIDE TO THE RAINY CITY from ZineQuest 2 last year. However, being system-agnostic, any busy GM needing quick flavor or interesting content can use FLOTTS VOL.2 for their own campaigns without the VISITOR'S GUIDE. As the good Mr. Flott advises above, rummage away, my friends!

Projected to come in around 7,500 words and 36 pages, FLOTTS VOL.2 will contain:

Themed sections for each of the Eight Districts of the Rainy City (Vagabond Bay, Old Town, Levee Town, the Sump, the Mids, Embassy Row, the Headlands, and the Tower Cliffs), as well as sections for the floating pirate haven of Rickety and the flooded Grand Academy of Magic beneath the mist-shrouded Murk;

A Neighborhood Spotlight section on the odd and magic-infested Old Town neighborhood of Eastcheap, offering more details about the residents, street life, and businesses found there, as well as a detailed map;

At least fifteen pieces (but probably more!) of original Rainy City art by Bill Spytma done in the woodcut style he used on the VISITOR'S GUIDE; and

A Tales of the Rainy City section on the Willoughby Ark Auction and Alefest that will serve as a short event scenario made up of interrelated narratives, art, charts, lists, and random tables–offering busy GMs helpful building blocks they can use to run this Rainy City event in their campaigns.

boardgame.name: Nemesis: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
This insert is compatible with Nemesis. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. The trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times. The rules and boards act as a lid on top of the trays.

The insert is arranged in up to three layers. Note that the character and intruder boards are stacked in the top right corner, and the hexagon room tiles are stacked centrally in the bottom layer.

The component types are split in several trays organising all the game components. There is space for all cards to be sleeved and the door tiles can be stored with their bases attached.

The insert includes one large card tray which goes in the base of the box. This tray is removable and also has space for sleeved cards. The tray has space for the base game cards and those from Nemesis: Aftermath & Void Seeders® expansion.

When packing away the game, first place the game board on top of the trays. Then add the room sheets and rule book on top. This fills the box to the top and allows for vertical storage, as well as easy transport of the game.

NB! Folded Space has a second Nemesis insert FS-NMS+ compatible with Aftermath & Void Seeders expansion box, with space for the Medic and Carnomorph expansions.

Note: The insert was designed for game with external box dimensions of 29.7 x 29.7 x 14.8cm.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Nemesis

listing.notes: Title: Folded Space Organizer - Nemesis Insert Publisher: Folded Space Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Nemesis: Aftermath & Void Seeders – Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
This insert is compatible with Nemesis: Aftermath & Void Seeders, including the Carnomorph and The Medic Character expansions. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.

This organizer is an add-on to the Folded Space FS-NMS insert for Nemesis, and the two inserts should be used together. Some cards, tokens, and tiles from the expansions need to be added to FS-NMS in the main game box.

The insert is arranged in up to two layers, this image shows the bottom layer. Note that there's a filler tray in the bottom right corner which also holds the hourglass.

The component types are split in several trays organising all the game components. There is space for all cards to be sleeved.

FS-NMS+ has a large card tray which is for the Carnomorph expansion cards. Some expansions comoponents though need to be added to the FS-NMS in the main game box:

Large and small cards from Aftermath & Void Seeders expansions;
Small cards from Carnomorph expansion;
All character boards;
Void Seeder and Carnomorph boards;
Room tiles;
Additional intruder carcass tokens.


When packing the box first place the shuttle board on top of the trays, followed by the three rule books. Once fully loaded the box is filled to the top, allowing for vertical storage.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 30.2 x 30.2 x 8.3 cm.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Nemesis: Aftermath
Nemesis: Aftermath & Void Seeders
Nemesis: Aftermath & Void Seeders & Medic
Nemesis: Carnomorphs
Nemesis: Medic Character Expansion
Nemesis: Void Seeders

listing.notes: Title: Folded Space Organizer - Nemesis: Aftermath & Void Seeders Expansions Insert Publisher: Folded Space Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Batman: Perigo em Gotham
boardgame.description:
From the publisher blurb:

In this exciting Gotham Danger board game, players must cross the board through the city of Gotham, beating villains such as Harlequin, Catwoman, Poison Ivy and Joker before the other players.

The board consists of 3 levels where players must move until they reach the Joker's Lair. The levels are linked by accesses indicated on the board through the villains' houses. When you conquer the villain of the first level, you are ready to face the next level and villain. The battles between you and the villains take place through a data dispute.

So you need to rely on luck in the dice and special houses to hinder opponents and / or not fall into the Joker 's house, as it will bring you down one level and will hinder your victory!

boardgame.name: Frozen Crashed Spaceship
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An ancient ice cavern reveals a floor of frozen metal sheets and support beams, with stairs leading into the belly of an alien spacecraft. Down there, strange glyphs are engraved into the floor of the ship. Nearby, broken metal grids cover large cables which flow like rivers beneath the floor.

There is a central octagonal chamber surrounded by eight metal pillars, and smaller chambers throughout the spaceship. Narrow maintenance hallways connect many of them, though most end in rubble.

How long has the ship been here, and is any of its technology still active?

boardgame.name: Excavated World Seed Spaceship
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An excavation has broken into an ancient cavern, filled with glowing plants of otherworldly colours. While it first appears to be a natural formation, closer inspection shows that there is metal plating on the floor, broken support beams, and stairways leading further down.

Adventure Seed

A mudslide exposed this cave and it’s since become an essential excavation site. You’ve been paid by a scholar to escort him to this remote location from a city, several days travel away. He was invited to join the excavation as the best expert they could find to help them understand what they’ve uncovered.
When you arrive, the site seems deserted. Venturing inside you are attacked by archaeologists covered with glowing blue and purple plants, their skin matching in colouration and pulsing with specs of light.
Deeper in, more people are kneeling before a pale, glowing bulb. Plants and flowers are slowly growing over them, but they are not yet as covered as the other archaeologists who first attacked. Their glazed eyes turn towards you as their mouths begin to rasp words...
WHAT’S HAPPENING? The excavation has uncovered an ancient spaceship, one of many sent by aliens to terraform various planets and make their environment habitable. However, this ship crashed and the Seed couldn’t spread life. Now that it’s been exposed to the surface, the Seed is determined to fulfil its purpose of making the planet habitable for its creators—regardless of the fact that life has since evolved.
The Seed is telekinetic and calls to the minds of surrounding lifeforms to kneel before it and slowly become covered by plants. It can talk with words through the humans it is in the process of changing, but the others roaming the excavation site are too far gone to speak.
It can only communicate its purpose directly via telepathic visions, such as a barren planet, the ship landing, and life blooming across the world’s surface. If the Seed is killed, the surrounding plant life and the growths on the archaeologists will shrivel and die. However, only those still kneeling near the Seed are unchanged enough to survive it.
The Seed has first created guards to protect itself, but plans to send those kneeling before it out into the world to spread itself further. When the flowers on their backs bloom with glowing white spores, they will spread and begin to change the rest of the planet.

boardgame.name: Infested Crashed Alien Spaceship
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What first appears to be a natural cavern reveals a floor of rusting metal sheets and support beams, with stairs leading into the belly of an alien spacecraft. Down there, strange glyphs are engraved into the floor of the ship. Nearby, broken metal grids cover large cables which flow like rivers beneath the floor. But there are things down on the second level, like eggs connected to fleshy tendrils that crawl over the floors, and cling to the walls. At their heart is a strange, larger thing that looks similar to a blooming flower… only it seems to be connected to the alien infestation.
Are the orbs the original inhabitants of the ship, or are they what destroyed them—and caused their vessel to crash?

boardgame.name: Crashed Alien Spaceship Excavation
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An excavation has broken into an ancient cavern, with a floor of rusting metal sheets and support beams. Stairs lead down into the belly of a long-buried alien spacecraft.
The second level is filled with thick cables covered by metal grids, with strange glyphs carved onto the floor. Small chambers and hallways crisscross the ship’s hull, while at its heart waits a large octagonal room. At its centre is a pale, circular platform. What does it do, and how much of the original technology has survived?

boardgame.name: Malthazar's Soulforge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A dead forest surrounds the discreet entryway into a cavern with a crumbling floor. Stone pavers have fallen away, revealing a decrepit second layer further below. An intact stairway leads further down, while a secondary passage provides an escape route, if needed.
Below, a spacious room awaits. Strange hieroglyphs are etched into its floor, while rusting steel grates cover liquid filled chambers and bronze pipes. At the heart of the Soulforge is a pulsing blue crystal, chained to the eight pillars which surround it.
Small maintenance hallways lead away from the central chamber, often ending in crumbling piles of rock where they have collapsed. The area smells like dust and the strange odour that rises out from the blue cable pits.

boardgame.name: Rocky T-Junction
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

ROCKY T JUNCTION

In Daylight and Moonlight

Full-Colour, Stunningly Rendered Battle Map

Perfectly scaled for printing on European A3 Paper, at 300dpi

boardgame.name: Paranormal Affairs Canada
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sparkling lakes filled with horned serpents.
Sprawling forests infested with wendigos.
Friendly cities hiding vampires.
Dark gods trying to rise.

Welcome to Canada.

In Paranormal Affairs Canada, you are an agent of a clandestine division of CSIS charged with protecting Canadians from supernatural and extraterrestrial threats, while keeping their existence secret.

Decades of immigration have added monsters from throughout the world to Canada's indigenous supernatural population. As these creatures encounter one another, they present newfound dangers to the mortal population.

With over 50 monsters from worldwide myth and folklore, Paranormal Affairs Canada gives you everything you need to track and neutralize monsters in the darkest corners of the Canadian mosaic.

Using the rules of Fate Core, play the character YOU want to play, and find out how far you're willing to go to keep your country safe.

boardgame.name: Save the Universe (Ashcan Version)
boardgame.description:
Tyranny and cruelty have spread across the galaxy, and only you can stop it!

Save the Universe is a sci-fi adventure roleplaying game in which the players create their own great galactic menace and then portray the brave heroes battling against it.

Will you be:

A relentless hunter, seeking revenge against the bloodthirsty admiral who bombed your home planet into oblivion?

A fallen noble, building a rebellion by forging interstellar alliances between feuding noble families?

A mysterious seer, searching for cosmic secrets, hoping to find a way to stop a plague of civilization-devouring alien insects?

By the time the pizza is gone, you’ll have an epic saga and a cast of characters. Then you can jump right into the action, with simple, story-focused rules that reduce prep time and reward players for pursuing their personal dramas.

Charge your blaster. Board your starship. Set your course.

Save the Universe.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Frontier
boardgame.description:
A Level 1 One-Shot

Publisher's blurb:

The cult of The Lord of Hunger preys on the small town of Pueblo Nuevo as a band of adventurers makes their way to the frontier town looking for fortune. The cultist routinely ambush caravans looking for easy prey, this time they’ll find steel and spells ready to meet them.

This module is designed to help a DM introduce a party of lv.1 to a new campaign, or as a fun easy to run one-shot. For new and experienced players this adventure has everything you’d expect of a fantasy rpg; evil cultists, role playing encounters, and heroic deeds.

boardgame.name: SAVE System Reference Document
boardgame.description:
These are the core rules behind the Save the Universe tabletop RPG, presented as an open-license standalone system. Use these rules to build your own quick-to-play, easy-to-prep RPG!

The rules of SAVE are simple and quickly taught. They promote improvisation and collaborative storytelling, reducing the work necessary to prepare and facilitate the game. Players build their characters from roles that illustrate genre archetypes, and from descriptions of talents and past events rather than mathematical statistics.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Awesome
boardgame.description:
A Simple RPG for Quick Adventure

Publisher's blurb:

Rules-lite fantasy RPG. Kill stuff. Loot stuff. Die. Repeat.

boardgame.name: Save the Realm (Roll to Craft Game Jam Draft)
boardgame.description:
Save the Realm is a roleplaying game about a group of heroes who undertake a journey to save their home from a dire threat. During the game, you’ll explore the motives of the heroes and the relationships between them, and you’ll decide how the quest changes them. The game takes its inspiration from fantasy quest stories such as J.R.R. Tolkien’s Lord of the Rings, L. Frank Baum’s The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, Seanan McGuire’s Beneath the Sugar Sky, and many other cartoons, books, and movies.

This game doesn’t come with its own setting. When you sit down to play, your group will imagine your own realm and heroes. There’s no need to prepare a world or adventure ahead of time, which makes this game well-suited for one-shots or conventions.

Save the Realm was developed for the Roll to Craft Game Jam. It's fully playable, but lacks polish and is due for more playtesting and editing.

If you're interested in a better-assembled version of this game, with a sci-fi theme, check out Save the Universe.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Ana-Sin-Emid Report
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

About an hour ago the Deep Space Transport Vessel Ana-Sin-Emid dropped out of FTL and has been steadily coasting to the outer marker. There has been no communication from the vessel or any responses to hails and the staging nature of the deceleration has the signs of being automated.

The Deep Space Reconnaissance Vessel Grahams is on dock C. Be ready to launch within the hour. Get on board the Ana-Sin-Emid, get to the bridge and report back to us. The outer marker is an AU out so it should only take you a day to get there. We’ll have a fully-equipped support ship loaded and ready to follow in about 12 hours, but you’re our first response to help and, if possible, lay a salvage claim.’

CONTENT WARNING: This adventure contains physical, psychological and body horror, so be sure to check with your players if they're good for that kind of game and use any safety protocols you might have, especially if it is being used in a convention.

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Legends - Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dark Age: Legends is a tabletop roleplay game which incorporates the ability to raise armies, sieze lands and earn titles.

Create your own unit unit types through a combination of different weapons, armour and levels of training. Generate revenue by taxing your lands. Meet the criteria to attain a title in this anarchic version of medieval history, where nobility is earned at the tip of a sword.

All this is done whilst roleplaying your Character in a series of events told by The Storyteller. Set during an anarchic alternate medieval timeline, during a power vacuum that will see your party own their destinies, gain titles and lands, command vast armies and strive to conquer their fate.

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Legends - Outlaws of Sherwood
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dark Age: Outlaws Of Sherwood is a Solo Story Adventure. The premise for the story, along with the endgame of the protagonists, is included along with a brief description of the setting and circumstances. The descriptions are provided for the purpose of immersion only.

You are the last of Robin Hood’s followers, and responsible for continuing his legacy. The fight against oppression did not end with the death of the Sheriff of Nottingham, and the power vacuum left in his stead will call for guile as well as force in order to navigate these new waters. Whatever comes next will be your greatest test.

The Story is your own to tell, and your Character is yours to play.

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Bushido
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Raise your clan, unite your people, stand with your friends and honour your name. Gather your weapons and ride for honour by the code of bushido in a land where the sun shall rise once more.

This tabletop roleplay experience combines the Storytelling narrative of a traditional pen and paper rpg with the grand scale of a wargame, with hundreds of combinations for creating your own units.

The Bushido Zen System will help your Character along their chosen path, and the Axiom system will help you to find your Character’s purpose.

You will never need more than two six-sided dice, a pencil and paper, and your imagination to play games set against the backdrop of feudal Japan. Embrace the way of the warrior, find your Bushido. This is your story.

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Bushido - Kyujutsu 弓術
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DARK AGE: BUSHIDO

弓術 Kyujutusu The Art Of Archery

Feudal combat engagement sometimes calls for patience and distance. Timing is key, as is knowing when and how to strike. A well-placed volley of arrows can be the pivotal moment in a battle, and the practitioner of Bushido may use this to their advantage.

This Expansion is provided to give even more flexibility to Character development, with four all new Vocational Axioms and a total of seventeen new Traits.

When the warrior wishes to defend their home, their land, their friends, or plainly their honour, sometimes the rules change. Sometimes the enemy needs to be kept at distance.

The Islands of Nippon have been home to expert archers since Neolithic times. Originally making the best of things with bone-tipped arrows and single pieces of curved wood, the Nihonjin evolved to use bows over two metres in height, firing arrows that could be up to one meter in length. In the hands of the Samurai class of warrior, the yumi (bow) was used to win wars and repel invasions from some of the fiercest fighting forces stalking the earth during feudal times.

The fundamental principle of kyujutsu is that of ‘seisha hitchu’ – ‘a true shot never misses’. By following the Shaho (the law of shooting), your arrow will find it’s mark.

Therefore keep your mind clear and embrace the state of fudoshin – to let go of ego, of doubt – to know everything is in accordance with how it should be. Then you will become one with your bow, and hit without hitting.

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Bushido - Kenjutsu 剣術
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An expansion for Dark Age: Bushido

Kenjutsu 剣術 (Methods And Techniques In The Art Of The Sword)

Advance from Imadoshin (Novice) all the way up to Choten (Zenith), with five new Vocational Axioms (Classes) each containing four Techniques (Traits) which become more powerful as you progress along the scale.

Discover Kenjutsu and take up the sword in order to defend your honour. The path of Kenjutsu offers the warrior each their own path to advance their journey.

Whether fighting in offense with determination to strike first, or purely in defense after seeking another way, the form within Kenjutsu is designed to maximise effectiveness with a straight edged weapon.

This Expansion is provided as a way for Player Characters to develop sword technique step by step. Players and Storytellers alike may use this guide as inspiration to come up with their own methods to elaborate expressions of combat.

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Bushido - The Mongols ᠮᠣᠩᠭᠣᠯᠴᠤᠳ
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DARK AGE: BUSHIDO

The Mongols ᠮᠣᠩᠭᠣᠯᠴᠤᠳ

Set in an alternate version of events in the history of the intriguing and often misunderstood Mongol people, where expansion takes place two generations early.

This Expansion provides additional Weapons and Armour along with new Axioms, Skills and Traits to enrich Mongol Characters and NPCs.

How will the people of feudal Nippon respond to this new arrival. What are the intentions of the Mongol visitors? Decide how the influence of Zen and Bushido impact events, and shape the outcome of the encounter - and therefore history.

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Bushido - The Way of the Empty Hand
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An expansion for Dark Age: Bushido

Introducing Four new Vocational Axioms (Classes) to enhance Character Development:

The Uchigane (Striker)

The Uchigane strikes quickly, often, and sometimes even before their opponent has made their move. Uchigane techniques require spatial awareness and can be very effective when dealing with multiple opponents.

The Rikishi (Wrestler)

The application of raw strength is the central focus of the Rikishi. The ability to utilise size, weight and centre of gravity in order to perform a lift, throw, slam or grapple can be treated as an art form by the highest practitioners, and a display of brute power by the lowest.

The Kanshi-Sha (Sentinel)

The Kanshi-Sha does not adhere to one form of combat; they will use any method necessary to evade attack and pacify a violent situation as soon as they can. When pushed, the Kanshi-Sha may turn an opponent’s aggression against them.

The Tatsujin (Master)

When the highest techniques available for Uchigane, Rikishi and Kanshi-Sha have been attained, the Character may proceed to learn the techniques of Tatsujin – the Master. Tatsujin techniques fuse striking, wrestling, and counter-fighting to evolve the practitioner into the purest martial artist they can be.

DARK AGE: BUSHIDO

The Way Of The Empty Hand

Discover new techniques to enhance the Player Character’s ability to fight without weapons. Gain knowledge of self, inner peace, and certainty in all events with this guide to self-defence – feudal style.

The origins of martial arts were born from necessity; to close with your opponent, especially when they were armed and you were not, took the bushido spirit to the next level. It is little wonder these techniques survive to present day in highly refined forms, and are still renowned as a source of honour and valour, and a positive method to unlock a person’s potential.

Learn the way of the empty hand and give your Player Characters a new edge in combat, and a new confidence in their abilities when dealing with story events.

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Bushido - Ninjutsu 忍術
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DARK AGE: BUSHIDO

忍術 NINJUTSU

The path of Bushido is not written in stone. Conventional rules of engagement may not apply to every situation, and not all who claim to fight with honour will be true to their word. Therefore to hide in the shadows, strike without fear, and turn things around on your target – these are all principles of the methodology of Ninjutsu.

Discover how to unlock these methods.

This Expansion is provided to give even more flexibility to Character development, with four all new Vocational Axioms

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Khurammites of Persia سرخ‌جامگان
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Khurammites sought peace where only conflict could be found. In this alternate historical setting peace was achieved by the dedication of the few for the many.

Take your Character along the path of the Sork-Jamagan, an elite fighting force trained to defend Persia by any means necessary.

This Expansion is provided to give even more flexibility to Character development, with three all new Vocational Axioms and a total of fifteen new Traits, along with new Weapons and Armour.

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Bushido - Ronin Song 浪人唄
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Kazuko had already reached her 18th year when an army, controlled by her father’s enemy, came to her village. Supposedly under instruction from the Emperor, all prominent families were called to form a line. Some of the men were pressed into military service and hauled away. Naturally, some resisted. Some, like Kazuko’s father and brothers, were executed. It is not clear how Kazuko escaped the massacre that ensued, or what motivated her next steps, but from that point she decided to follow her own path.

Now one year older, Kazuko found herself at a crossroads, spiritually and literally. She had learned of the whereabouts of a Bansho (Captain) who had been among the first to butcher her kin on that fateful day. Standing in the rain letting each droplet of water temper the fire in her soul, Kazuko contemplated what was to be done. Her father’s words echoed in her mind. Do not be one with anger. Be at peace, without your enemy. These words comforted Kazuko, and for a moment she looked to the floor in remembrance of her family. When her gaze returned to the fork in the road ahead, Kazuko’s mind was made up.

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Legends - Thanes of Alba
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are a member of Clan Crannach, a valued branch of the Scottish House of Moray. Following the death of your liege, King Macbeth, you are thrust into danger by the conquering Malcolm III. With the emergence of Normandy as a great European power, a precarious alliance between England and Scotland, and the desire of the Danish King Hardrada to restore the Danelaw in England, you find yourself in the Scottish Lowlands with a few loyal friends, trying to survive.

The Story is your own to tell, and your Character is yours to play.

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Legends - The Vikings
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The formidable Vikings make a fulfilling addition to any Adventure. Brutal but observant, intelligent but ruthless, the Vikings were an enigma to those who did not care to earn their respect.

In an alternate history where the Viking culture resisted conversion to Christianity, their true potential may become revealed. Will time temper the hearts of these fearsome warriors, or will a renewed zeal for the Old Norse ways spur them onward?

Included within this Expansion are four new Vocational Axioms (Classes) giving access to 19 new Techniques/Traits. There are also new Weapons and Armour to add to the existing Dark Age armoury.
...
In 1132 the seafaring peoples known as the Vikings are thriving. Being the last European power to reject Christianity, their methods of survival have intensified. Though the remnents of the Danelaw in England are diminishing, the Vikings have kept a unified Scandinavia, banding together to resist Christendom and those who serve the Pope.

King Magnus IV of Scandinavia has issued a decree that those who who are able to gain a sustainable foothold and restore the glory days of Viking conquest on foreign shores, shall be rewarded with titles, lands, and their seat in Valhalla.

The subject of derision from the rest of the Known World due to the percieved brutality of their methods, the Vikings share an uneasy peace with their European and Russian neighbours.

With trade routes secure to distant Eastern lands and settlements as far afield as across the Atlantic Sea, the potential for a new Viking expansion is clear.

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Legends - The Black Prince
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Starter Set - Including Adventure, Vocational Axioms, Weapons, Armour and NPCs

The Black Prince is alive and well in the year 1377, aware of the threats to both himself and the Kingdom of England. Keen to take his rightful place in history, the Prince seeks to forge a Knightly Order based on the principles of truth and courage. Where nobility is earned honour is willingly pledged.

The scene is set for a story of valour to be told.

Included within this Expansion is a full Adventure, new Vocational Axioms (ranks within the Knightly Order of Dien) new Weapons and Armour and a full list of NPCs to bring the Adventure to life.
...
The year is 1377. Edward of Woodstock, Prince of Wales and heir to the English throne, is a man who refuses to die. Having foiled an assassination attempt in 1376 with little help from those around him, The Black Prince is about to succeed his father, Edward III, who’s death seems imminent.

Aware of his own failing health but determined to take his rightful place in history as King of England, Edward is aware that he requires strong allies to see him through his accession.

After one drawn-out evening at Court, observing the nobles circling her father-in-law’s deathbed like jackals at the carcass of a lion, Edward’s wife Joan of Kent visits her husband in his chamber. After much deliberation, and Joan tempering Edward’s concerns with a fondness only she is able to convey, the future King and Queen devise a plan to keep the enemy from the gates.

A tournament is to be held unlike any other witnessed by the English people. All who are true of heart are encouraged to attend, not just the nobility. The Black Prince is keen to identify those capable of fighting for personal honour, rather than noble favour. At Joan’s suggestion Edward is to form a new Knightly Order – The Order of Dien (meaning ‘to serve’) for those who demonstrate true chivalric qualities at the grand tournament.

For The Black Prince and the Fair Maid of Kent, their hope is to inspire loyalty and devotion through raising the fortunes of the brave. For the men and women who will join the Order of Dien the path may be long and the years may be short, but their courage will shape a Kingdom. This is their story.

boardgame.name: Beasts of Maravilla Island
boardgame.description: Take on the role of a young wildlife photographer to discover and capture the extraordinary creatures of a magical jungle when Beasts of Maravilla Island

boardgame.name: Savior
boardgame.description:
They asked for your help. You came to save them. You failed.

Savior is a voice recording and journaling experience for one traveller set within the limits of space and communities living within the vast galaxies. Travellers enter communities, experience their wonders, and try to help prevent the fall of them from systemic and community issues.

The savior will not be able to save the community. This is their story on trying, failing, despair, hope, and learning.

Designed for the Ad Astra jam.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Scary Monsters & Nice Sprites
boardgame.description:
Scary Monsters and Nice Sprites is a narrative RPG about spending your night in one of the only clubs in your city that’s safe for creatures of the night like yourself. All you want to do is have some fun just like the humans do. Play a supernatural creature of choice, put some sick EDM on the speakers and get your game on!

What you need in order to play:

An even number of players. 2-6 would be optimal.
Tokens, or things that can be used as tokens
Four-sided dice (d4), six-sided dice (d6), eight-sided dice (d8), ten-sided dice (d10), and twelve-sided dice (d12). You can share, but it’d be good if each player had their own set!
Some paper and things to write with in order to keep track of stuff easier.
No GM needed for this one! This game is designed to make all of you storytellers with an equal stake in how the story of your night(s) together go.

The basic premise of this game involves all of your characters hanging around at the same, supernaturals only place after dark – a night club, a concert, a bar, a coffeeshop, wherever you fancy as players. For one reason or another, you’re there to unwind, chill, and maybe – just maybe, find somebody to spend the night with. Each of you interact with each other by choosing the way you approach each other, rolling to see how successful you were, then narrating how scenes go based on the results. You’ll show each other your character’s approval for how well the flirting is going by giving each other tokens. You’ll also be able to spend tokens to make sure conditions in the club are just right.

This game was submitted for the Hot Horror Game Jam in 2019!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Express (Issue 1 - Jan/Feb? 1988)
boardgame.description: Published in early 1988 (January or February), the first FE issue delivers articles and some "generic" fantasy content with stats primarily for DSA and Midgard.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Aus dem Leben des Dumnus Raffnix
[Des Meisters Helden] Maltos, Kaufmann und ehemaliger Abenteurer

boardgame.name: Skytear: Silent Ambassador
boardgame.description:
Silent Ambassadors are attracted by sorrow and violence, these creatures haunt the battlefields in search of victims to wreak their deadly needs against, often assuming humanoid features by using the debris around them in a grotesque caricature of the ones who created them.

The expansion contains:

1 Silent Ambassador preassembled and unpainted miniature (38mm).
7 Outsider Cards, one for each of these languages: English, Italian, Portuguese, French, German, Spanish, Polish.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Paris: l'Étoile
París: La Estrella
巴黎美好年代：星級都會
boardgame.description:
A few years have passed since the events of Paris. You have invested in many of Paris’ most prestigious building and landmarks, and have made quite the name for yourself. But that does not mean you can rest on your laurels: shrewd foreign investors have set their eye on the French capital, eager to become important players as well in the Parisian real estate market. The most coveted properties are all centered around the most most famous roundabout in the world: La Place de l’Étoile, that features the iconic Arc de Triomphe, which looks down on the Champs-Élysées. They are up for quite the challenge, since your experience will give you unique advantages over your opponents.

Paris : l'Étoile introduces a new collection of bonus tiles, which will add more variety and replayability to your game of Paris, as well as strategy tiles. These will give each player a unique player power, that they can choose to change if they place one of their keys on the Arc de Triomphe.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Fou Fou Fou!: Plaisir d'offrir!
boardgame.description:
This game use the same mechanic as "Fou Fou Fou !", but add a new twist:
When a player draws a pink card, he gives it to another player of his/her choice. This increases even more the interactions.

The present game can be played independently from the previous opus, or can be combined with it.

boardgame.name: Draconic Options
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Harness the power of dragons in this installment of Unearthed Arcana! This playtest document presents race, feat, and spell options related to dragons in Dungeons & Dragons. First is a trio of draconic race options presented as an alternative to the dragonborn race in the Player’s Handbook, as well as a fresh look at the kobold race. Then comes a handful of feat options that reflect a connection to draconic power. Finally, an assortment of spells—many of them bearing the names of famous or infamous dragons—offer a variety of approaches to manifesting dragon magic.

boardgame.name: Folk of the Feywild
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wander into the magical realm of the Feywild in this month’s Unearthed Arcana! With the playtest options in the PDF below, your D&D character can be a member of one of these new D&D races: fairy, hobgoblin of the Feywild, owlfolk, or rabbitfolk.

boardgame.name: Fairy Lights
boardgame.description:
Push your luck with Fairy Lights to collect as many points as possible!

To play, shuffle the deck and place it face down. Cards in the deck show 1 or 2 bulbs in one of five colors, and each card is worth 0-2 points. At the start of your turn, see how many cards are in the "shop", the central area of play:


If the shop has 5 cards, you can only take cards on your turn.
If the shop has 1-4 cards, you may draw from the deck.
If the shop has 0 cards, you must draw.


When you draw, place the revealed card at the end of the shop line. If it's the same color as the last card in the shop, your turn ends immediately. Otherwise, if the shop doesn't contain five cards, you can choose to draw again, or you can end your turn and take cards. If five cards are now in the shop, you must take cards.

When you take cards, if 1-4 cards are in the shop, take all cards of a single color from the shop and add them to your collection; if five cards are in the shop, take all cards of two colors from the shop instead. If the number of bulbs in a color in your collection is now a multiple of three (3, 6, 9, 12), score those cards, placing them face down in a corner of your playing area. If you have 1-2 bulbs of a color, leave those cards where they are. If you have four or more bulbs of a color and didn't score them, discard all bulbs of that color. The next player then takes their turn.

When the final card is revealed from the deck, the active player finishes their turn, then the game ends. Add the points on your scored cards, then subtract the points showing on all cards that remain in your playing area. Whoever ends up with the most points wins!
